member.name: N:Microsoft.Data.Caching
member.summary: The namespace provides access to an in-memory application cache application for developing scalable, high-performance applications. This namespace can be used to cache any common language runtime (CLR) object and provides access through simple APIs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache
member.summary: The object that is used by cache-enabled applications for storing and retrieving objects from the cache cluster. An instance of this object is referred to as the cache client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag})
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. This method enables associating tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
An array of objects to associate with the cached object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object to a region in the cache.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
The name of the region to save the object in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. This method provides the ability to specify when the object should be expired.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object to a region in the cache. This method enables associating tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
An array of objects to associate with the cached object.
The name of the region to save the object in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag})
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. This method enables associating tags with the cached object and specifying when the object should be expired.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.
An array of objects to associate with the cached object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object to a region in the cache. This method provides the ability to specify when the object should be expired.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.
The name of the region to save the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object to a region in the cache. This method enables associating tags with the cached object and specifying when the object should be expired.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: A unique value that is used to store and retrieve the object from the cache.
The object saved to the cache cluster.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.
An array of objects to associate with the cached object.
The name of the region to save the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.AddCacheLevelCallback(Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationCallback)
member.summary: Adds a cache notification callback for cache operations occurring on all regions and items.
member.returns: A object used to identify the cache notification callback.
member.param: The type of cache operation(s) that will trigger cache notifications.
The name of the method you want to invoke when these notifications occur.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.AddFailureNotificationCallback(Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFailureNotificationCallback)
member.summary: Adds a failure notification callback, for notifications indicating that a client has missed one or more cache notifications.
member.returns: A object used to identify the cache notification callback.
member.param: The name of the method that you want to invoke when the failure notification occurs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.AddItemLevelCallback(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationCallback)
member.summary: Adds a cache notification callback for cache operations occurring on one specific item that is not stored in a region.
member.returns: A object used to identify the cache notification callback.
member.param: The key used to store the object in the cache.
The type of cache operation(s) that will trigger cache notifications.
The name of the method you want to invoke when these notifications occur.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.AddItemLevelCallback(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationCallback,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a cache notification callback for cache operations occurring on one specific item that is stored in region.
member.returns: A object used to identify the cache notification callback.
member.param: The key used to store the object in the cache.
The type of cache operation(s) that will trigger cache notifications.
The name of the method you want to invoke when these notifications occur.
The name of the region where the object is stored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.AddRegionLevelCallback(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationCallback)
member.summary: Adds a cache notification callback for cache operations occurring on one specific region.
member.returns: A object used to identify the cache notification callback.
member.param: The name of the region for which the specified item or region operations can trigger cache notifications.
The type of cache operation(s) that will trigger cache notifications.
The name of the method you want to invoke when these notifications occur.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.ClearRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes all objects in the specified region.
member.param: The name of the region whose objects are removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.CreateRegion(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a region and specifies if resident objects may be evicted.
member.param: The name of the region that is created.
True if objects in the region can be evicted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the cache using the specified key.
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Get(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheItemVersion@)
member.summary: Gets an object from the cache using the specified key. You may also provide the version to obtain the specific version of a key, if that version is still the most current in the cache.
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the key does not exist. Even if the key does exist, null may also be returned because the object has been updated to a new version.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The version of the desired object. If this parameter is null, the version of the current object is retrieved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Get(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the specified region by using the specified key.
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The name of the region where the object resides.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Get(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheItemVersion@,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the specified region by using the specified key. You may also provide the version to obtain the specific version of a key, if that version is still the most current in the region.
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the key does not exist. Even if the key does exist, null may also be returned because the object has been updated to a new version.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The version of the desired object. If this parameter is null, the version of the current object is retrieved.
The name of the region where the object resides.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetAndLock(System.String,System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle@)
member.summary: Returns and locks the cached object (if present).
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the object has already been locked or the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
A non-zero value indicating how many minutes the object remains locked.
The object required to unlock the object. The lockHandle output parameter is passed by reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetAndLock(System.String,System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Returns and locks the cached object (if present). For objects stored in regions.
member.returns: The object that was cached by using the specified key. Null is returned if the object has already been locked or the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
A non-zero value indicating how many minutes the object remains locked.
The object required to unlock the object. The lockHandle output parameter is passed by reference.
The name of the region where the object resides.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetCacheItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a object to retrieve all information associated with your cached object in the cluster.
member.returns: A object that contains all information associated with your cached object. Null is returned if the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetCacheItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a object to retrieve all information associated with your cached object in the cluster. For objects stored in regions.
member.returns: A object that contains all information associated with your cached object. Null is returned if the key does not exist.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The name of the region where the object resides.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetIfNewer(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheItemVersion@)
member.summary: Gets an object from the cache, but only if a newer version of the object resides in the cache.
member.returns: If the version in the cache differs from the version parameter, the corresponding cached object is returned. If the version in the cache is the same as the version parameter, null is returned.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache. If this parameter is null, an exception is thrown.
The version of the desired object, passed by reference. If this parameter is null, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetIfNewer(System.String,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheItemVersion@,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the specified region, but only if a newer version of the object resides in the region.
member.returns: If the version in the region differs from the version parameter, the corresponding cached object is returned. If the version in the region is the same as the version parameter, null is returned.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache. If this parameter is null, an exception is thrown.
The version of the desired object, passed by reference. If this parameter is null, an exception is thrown.
The name of the region where the object resides.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetObjectsByAllTags(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have all the same tags in common.
member.returns: An enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have all the same tags in common. Null is returned if no objects in the specified region have all the tags specified.
member.param: A list of tags for which to search.
The name of the region to search. Tags are not supported outside regions. Therefore, a region name is required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetObjectsByAnyTag(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have any of the same tags in common.
member.returns: An enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have any of the same tags in common. Null is returned if no objects in the specified region have any of the tags specified.
member.param: A list of tags for which to search.
The name of the region to search. Tags are not supported outside regions. Therefore, a region name is required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetObjectsByTag(Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have the specified tag.
member.returns: An enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region that have the specified tag. Null is returned if no objects in the specified region have the tag specified.
member.param: The tag for which to search.
The name of the region to search. Tags are not supported outside regions. Therefore, a region name is required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.GetObjectsInRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region.
member.returns: An enumerable list of all cached objects in the specified region.
member.param: The name of the region for which to return a list of all resident objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Put(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds or replaces an object in the cache.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Put(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheItemVersion)
member.summary: Adds or replaces an object in the cache if it is at the specified version.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.
The object that represents the version of the cached object that is to be replaced.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Put(System.String,System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag})
member.summary: Adds or replaces an object in the cache. Associates tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.
A list of tags to associate with the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.Put(System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Adds or replaces an object in the specified region.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the object saved to the cache under the key value.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The object to add or replace.
The name of the region the object resides in.

member.summary: Adds or replaces an object in the cache. Specifies the timeout value of the cached object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle)
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the cache.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag})
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the cache. Associates tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
A list of tags to associate with the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the specified region.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
The name of the region the object resides in.

member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the cache. Specifies the timeout value of the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.

The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the specified region. Associates tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.

The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag})
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the cache. Specifies the timeout value and associates tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the cache.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.TimeSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the specified region. Specifies the timeout value of the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.The timeout value associated with the cached object overrides expiration settings specified in the named cache configuration. For more information, see Expiration and Eviction (Velocity).
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.
The name of the region the object resides in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCache.PutAndUnlock(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLockHandle,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheTag},System.String)
member.summary: Replaces and unlocks an object in the specified region. Specifies the timeout value and associates tags with the cached object.
member.returns: A object that represents the version of the cached object after it has been updated by this method. If the lockHandle parameter is not equal to the object obtained from the method that is used to lock the object, null is returned and the object is not updated.
member.param: The unique value that is used to identify the object in the region.
The object to add or replace.
The object that was returned when the object was locked.
A non-zero value that is used to specify how many minutes the object should reside in the cache before expiration.
A list of tags to associate with the object.
The name of the region the object resides in.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory
member.summary: Provides methods to return objects that are mapped to a named cache. This class also enables programmatic configuration of the cache client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Used for configuring a cache client based on the application configuration file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.#ctor(Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheServerEndpoint[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used for configuring a cache client programmatically, based on the parameter values provided.
member.param: The cache host configuration for the cache client, for an array of objects.
True when the method returns routing clients; otherwise, it returns simple clients.
True when local cache is enabled on the cache client; otherwise, local cache is disabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.#ctor(Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheServerEndpoint[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLocalCacheSyncPolicy,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used for configuring a cache client programmatically, based on the parameter values provided. Additional parameters provided for working with cache notifications.
member.param: The cache host configuration for the cache client, for an array of objects.
True when the method returns routing clients; otherwise, it returns simple clients.
True when local cache is enabled on the cache client; otherwise, local cache is disabled.
Specifies the way locally cached objects should be invalidated, as defined by the enumeration.

The number of seconds that objects will remain in local cache before they are invalidated. Not applicable to notification-based invalidation. For more information, see Expiration and Eviction (Velocity).
The interval, in seconds, in which the cache client checks with the cache cluster for new notifications. Default value is 300 seconds. For more information, see Cache Notifications (Velocity).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.CreateLogSinks(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLogSink})
member.summary: Allows you to set the log levels on one or more log sinks for the cache client.
member.param: Log level settings for one or more log sinks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.DisableLogSinks
member.summary: Disables all log sinks on the cache client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the object and releases all associated resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.EnableAllAvailableSinks
member.summary: Enables all available log sinks on the cache client, with the EventTrace level equal to Warning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.GetCache(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cache client, an instance of the object.
member.returns: The cache client, an instance of the object.
member.param: The named cache to use for cache operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.GetDefaultCache
member.summary: Returns the cache client corresponding to the default cache; an instance of the object.
member.returns: The cache client, an instance of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFactory.Timeout
member.summary: The duration of time, in milliseconds, that the cache client will wait to communicate with the cache cluster before it throws a timeout exception.
member.returns: A System.Timespan object that represents the duration of time, in milliseconds, that the cache client will wait to communicate with the cache cluster before it throws a timeout exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheFailureNotificationCallback
member.summary: Specifies the parameters required for a method to be invoked by a failure notification when the cache client misses cache notifications.
member.param: The name of the cache associated with the missing notifications.
The object associated with the failure notification that invoked the delegate method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLocalCacheSyncPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the way locally cached objects should be invalidated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLocalCacheSyncPolicy.NotificationBased
member.summary: Specifies that objects will stay in local cache until they are automatically invalidated by a cache notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheLocalCacheSyncPolicy.TimeoutBased
member.summary: Specifies that objects will stay in local cache until their lifetime reaches the localCacheTimeout duration specified in the constructor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationCallback
member.summary: Specifies the parameters required for a method to be invoked by a cache notification.
member.param: The name of the cache associated with the cache operation.
The name of the region associated with the cache operation. A zero-length string indicates that a specific region is not associated with the cache operation.
The name of the key associated with the cache operation. A zero-length string indicates that a specific cached item is not associated with the cache operation.
The of the cached object associated with the cache operation that triggered the notification. A null version indicates that a specific cached item is not associated with the cache operation.
The enumeration specifying which cache event triggered the cache notification.
The object associated with the cache notification that invoked the delegate method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationDescriptor
member.summary: Identifies a cache notification callback. This identifier is required to remove the corresponding cache notification callback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationDescriptor.ToString
member.summary: Creates a copy of the object.
member.returns: A string value representing the and property values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationDescriptor.CacheName
member.summary: he name of the cache triggering the cache notification.
member.returns: A string value represents the name of the cache triggering the cache notification.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheNotificationDescriptor.DelegateID
member.summary: Identifier for the object. Used to distinguish between objects.
member.returns: A System.Int64 value used to identify objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation
member.summary: An enumeration used to specify specific item or region events that can trigger a cache notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation.CreateRegion
member.summary: Indicates that a region in the cache was created with the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation.RemoveItem
member.summary: Indicates that an object was removed from the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation.RemoveRegion
member.summary: Indicates that a region in the cache was removed with the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheOperation.ReplaceItem

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheSessionStoreProvider.CreateNewStoreData(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new data storage object for the current request.
member.returns: A object, used for storing session data in the distributed cache.
member.param: The HttpContext for the current request.
The session state Timeout value for the new object.

member.summary: Adds a new session state to the distributed cache.

The session identifier for the current request.
The session Timeout for the current request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheSessionStoreProvider.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheSessionStoreProvider.EndRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Called by the class at the end of a request.
member.param: The HttpContext for the current request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheSessionStoreProvider.GetItem(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: Returns read-only session-state data from the cache.
member.returns: A SessionStateStoreData object populated with session values and information from the cache.
member.param: The HttpContext of the current request.
The session identifier for the current request.
When this method returns, contains a Boolean value that is set to true if the requested session item is locked in the cache; otherwise, false.
When this method returns, contains a TimeSpan object that is set to the period of time that an item in the cache has been locked.
When this method returns, contains an object that is set to the lock identifier for the current request.
When this method returns, contains one of the SessionStateActions values. This indicates whether the current session is an uninitialized, cookieless session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Caching.DataCacheSessionStoreProvider.GetItemExclusive(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: Returns and locks the read-only session-state data from the cache.
member.returns: A SessionStateStoreData object populated with session values and information from the cache.
member.param: The HttpContext of the current request.
The session identifier for the current request.
When this method returns, contains a Boolean value that is set to true if a lock in the cache is successfully obtained; otherwise, false.
When this method returns, contains a TimeSpan object that is set to the period of time that an item in the cache has been locked.
When this method returns, contains an object that is set to the lock identifier for the current request.
When this method returns, contains one of the SessionStateActions values. This indicates whether the current session is an uninitialized, cookieless session.
